Advanced Vocabulary - Page 9

Advanced

Advanced Vocabulary - Page 9

Enhance your sophisticated vocabulary with these advanced terms that demonstrate intellectual depth and precise expression in formal discourse.

Navigation

This is page 9 of 12. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Intrinsic

/ɪnˈtrɪnsɪk/

adjective

Belonging naturally; essential; inherent.

Daxili, təbii

"The intrinsic value of education extends beyond monetary benefits."

"Təhsilin daxili dəyəri maddi faydalardan daha çoxdur."

Synonyms: inherent, essential, fundamental

Category: Nature

Invective

/ɪnˈvektɪv/

noun

Insulting, abusive, or highly critical language.

Təhqiramiz

"The politician's speech was filled with invective against his opponents."

"Siyasətçinin nitqi rəqiblərinə qarşı təhqiramiz sözlərlə dolu idi."

Synonyms: abuse, vituperation, denunciation

Category: Criticism

Irascible

/ɪˈræsəbəl/

adjective

Having or showing a tendency to be easily angered.

Hirsli, əsəbi

"The irascible old man shouted at children who played near his yard."

"Əsəbi qoca həyətində oynayan uşaqlara qışqırırdı."

Synonyms: irritable, hot-tempered, cantankerous

Category: Temperament

Jocular

/ˈdʒɑːkjələr/

adjective

Fond of or characterized by joking; humorous or playful.

Zarafatcıl

"His jocular manner made even serious meetings more enjoyable."

"Onun zarafatcıl tərzi ciddi görüşləri belə daha xoş edirdi."

Synonyms: humorous, playful, jovial

Category: Humor

Jubilation

/ˌdʒubəˈleɪʃən/

noun

A feeling of great happiness and triumph.

Sevinc

"The team's victory was met with jubilation from the fans."

"Komandanın qələbəsi azarkeşlər tərəfindən sevinclə qarşılandı."

Synonyms: elation, exultation, celebration

Category: Emotion

Judicious

/dʒuˈdɪʃəs/

adjective

Having, showing, or done with good judgment or sense.

Ağıllı, düşüncəli

"Her judicious use of resources ensured the project's success."

"Onun resurslardan ağıllı istifadəsi layihənin uğurunu təmin etdi."

Synonyms: wise, sensible, prudent

Category: Wisdom

Laconic

/ləˈkɑːnɪk/

adjective

Using few words; expressing much in few words.

Qısa, yığcam

"His laconic response of 'Maybe' left everyone uncertain."

"Onun 'Bəlkə' kimi yığcam cavabı hamını qeyri-müəyyən vəziyyətdə qoydu."

Synonyms: brief, concise, terse

Category: Communication

Lascivious

/ləˈsɪviəs/

adjective

Feeling or revealing an overt and often offensive sexual desire.

Şəhvətli

"The lascivious comments made everyone uncomfortable."

"Şəhvətli şərhlər hamını narahat etdi."

Synonyms: lecherous, lustful, licentious

Category: Behavior

Lucid

/ˈlusɪd/

adjective

Expressed clearly; easy to understand; clear-thinking.

Aydın

"Despite his age, he remained lucid and articulate."

"Yaşına baxmayaraq, o, aydın düşüncəli və səlis danışan idi."

Synonyms: clear, coherent, rational

Category: Clarity

Lugubrious

/ləˈɡubriəs/

adjective

Looking or sounding sad and dismal.

Kədərli

"The lugubrious music perfectly matched the somber occasion."

"Kədərli musiqi matəm mərasiminə tam uyğun idi."

Synonyms: mournful, doleful, melancholy

Category: Mood

Magnanimous

/mægˈnænəməs/

adjective

Generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or less powerful person.

Alicənab

"In a magnanimous gesture, he congratulated his opponent on the victory."

"Alicənab bir jest olaraq, o, rəqibini qələbə münasibətilə təbrik etdi."

Synonyms: generous, noble, benevolent

Category: Character

Malfeasance

/mælˈfizəns/

noun

Wrongdoing, especially by a public official.

Qanunsuzluq

"The mayor was accused of malfeasance in office."

"Mer vəzifəsində qanunsuzluqda ittiham olundu."

Synonyms: misconduct, wrongdoing, corruption

Category: Ethics
